title: SNOWPARK_CONTAINER_SERVICES_HISTORY view | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: Available to accounts in AWS and Microsoft Azure commercial regions, with some exceptions. For more information, see Available regions.

The SNOWPARK_CONTAINER_SERVICES_HISTORY view in the ACCOUNT_USAGE schema can be used to return the hourly
compute pool credit usage for an account within the last 365 days (1 year).
The date and beginning of the hour (in the local time zone) in which the usage took place.
The date and end of the hour (in the local time zone) in which the usage took place.
Name of the compute pool which incurred the credit usage.
TRUE, if the compute pool was created for an application.
The name of the application for which the compute pool was created. NULL if the compute pool was not created for an application or if the application no longer exists.
The ID of the application for which the compute pool was created; otherwise NULL.
Number of credits the compute pool used in the hour.
Latency for the view may be up to 180 minutes (3 hours).
The view provides hourly compute pool credit usage for an account within the last 365 days (1 year).
The credit rate usage is determined based on the machine type (instance family) of the compute pool, as outlined in the consumption table.
